title: Two Black Women Sue Fox News For ‘Top-Down Racial Harassment’
text:
Fox News Host Rips Trump For Blaming Dems For Obamacare Replacement’s Failure 
Fox last week announced it had fired Slater, who had been with the media giant for 19 years. 
“We take any complaint of this nature very seriously and took the appropriate action in investigating and firing Ms. Slater within two weeks of this being brought to our attention,” a Fox statement said. “There is no place for abhorrent behavior like this at Fox News.” 
The lawsuit was filed by Tichaona Brown, a payroll manager, and Tabrese Wright, a payroll coordinator, who accused Slater of making racially charged comments. They allege she called black men “women beaters” and said blacks wanted to physically harm whites.   
The suit claims Slater said black employees mispronounced words, such as “mother,” “father,” and “ask,” and told Brown to say them aloud at a meeting. Slater is also accused of asking Wright if all three of her children were “fathered by the same man.” 
Both The Wrap and Variety in their reports of Slater’s dismissal noted that she was also accused of calling black women “sista.” She also allegedly raised her hands in a “Hands up, don’t shoot” gesture when she was wished a goodnight by two black employees. 
“We are confident that the good men and women of the Bronx will hold Fox accountable for what we believe to be its abhorrent racist conduct, reminiscent of the Jim Crow era,” lawyers Douglas H. Wigdor and Jeanne Christensen of the Wigdor law firm said in a statement. 
Brown and Wright are suing Slater, Fox News and its parent company, 21st Century Fox, claiming that Slater’s superiors did little to address her behavior, creating a hostile work environment that resulted in “severe and pervasive discrimination and harassment.”
